intro: Litosanthes longicauda, commonly known as the long-tailed lithosanthes, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Litosanthes longicauda is adapted to grow in dry, rocky habitats and is considered a rare and endemic species.
